programmes.show_description: Shadow of the Wars: Exploring a dystopian powerhouse in Pennsylvania, a fairy-tale castle in Poland, and Anglo-Saxon religious ruins across the vast plains of Scotland.
Death in Paradise: Exploring a bloody battleground on the Pacific Island of Peleliu and an ominous military stronghold in Russia.
German Aviation: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.
Shopping from Home.
Chicago to Champaign, Illinois: Michael Portillo travels from Chicago to Champaign, Illinois, visiting the Frank Lloyd Wright house that changed US architecture.
Illinois to Tennessee: Michael Portillo gets a taste of the early life of President Lincoln, learns about Samuel Langhorne Clemens, aka Mark Twain, and joins Elvis fans at Graceland.
DBS/Ford Escort RS2000: Derek's on his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest-priced item at his next auction, but the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage.
Ford Ranchero / Thames Truck: Derek has learnt to expect the unexpected over the years, so it's not a surprise when Call the Midwife star Cliff Parisi drops off his Bedford CA campervan.
Krupp: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.
Weapons of War: The story of World War I, told through revealing data. Around 25,000 miles of trenches were cut as the sides dug in and UK factories built 30,000 aircraft a year.
Helmingham Hall 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Helmingham Hall in Suffolk, where experts examine a medieval sword found in a pond, an Indian jewel and a collection of decorative boxes.
Black Country Living Museum 2: Fiona Bruce presents a second visit to the Black Country Living Museum, where items include one of the rarest guns featured on the show.

Bond Bugs/Westfalia/Renault 4/MGB: Derek checks out an abandoned 1985 Renault 4 and an MGB Roadster that hasn't seen the light of day for 36 years, and Jack heads to Rotherham to pick up a pair of rar

Mini Mayfair/NSU Quickly: In the 100th episode, Derek heads to Northumberland to collect a rare 1975 NSU RO 80, Jack deals with a Mini Mayfair stuck in a barn, and an Aston Martin DBS husk is auctione
Krupp: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.
Weapons of War: The story of World War I, told through revealing data. Around 25,000 miles of trenches were cut as the sides dug in and UK factories built 30,000 aircraft a year.
Helmingham Hall 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Helmingham Hall in Suffolk, where experts examine a medieval sword found in a pond, an Indian jewel and a collection of decorative boxes.
Simon begins his journey on the island of Hispaniola and its two very different countries of the Dominican Republic - a tourist hotspot - and its poorer neighbour Haiti.
The Nicked Airmen: The bawdy wartime farce. When the British airmen are arrested paddling a tin bath down the estuary, Rene and co have to rescue them from the chateau - in coffins.
The Airmen De-Nicked: Hop over the channel for a rendezvous with Rene and his wartime chums. Using hijacked German uniforms, Michelle of the Resistance plans to infiltrate German HQ.
The Crooked Fences: Saucy wartime sitcom that's a big hit across Europe. Cafe Rene is the venue for a clandestine deal involving the infamous Fallen Madonna and a cuckoo clock weight.

Bond Bugs/Westfalia/Renault 4/MGB: Derek checks out an abandoned 1985 Renault 4 and an MGB Roadster that hasn't seen the light of day for 36 years, and Jack heads to Rotherham to pick up a pair of rar

Mini Mayfair/NSU Quickly: In the 100th episode, Derek heads to Northumberland to collect a rare 1975 NSU RO 80, Jack deals with a Mini Mayfair stuck in a barn, and an Aston Martin DBS husk is auctione
Before The Crown: Exploring the honeymoon home of a young princess and grand monuments designed by the most notorious dictator of the twentieth century.
Megalomaniac's Paradise: Exploring a once-lavish palace in Iraq - the Sathorn Unique - an epic ghost tower in Thailand, and a former sports stadium in Georgia in the United States.
Krupp: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.
Shopping from Home.
Reno To The Napa Valley: Michael Portillo travels from Reno, Nevada to California's Napa County, taking to the skies over the Sierra Nevada mountain range.
San Francisco: Michael Portillo's journey's to San Francisco, where he travels through the city's streets by cable car, before heading across the bay to Sausalito.
Renault 5: Gus twists Will's arm when he spies a super-rare Renault 5, but back at the workshop they realise they have one heck of a problem to fix.
VW Beetle: Gus and Will want to buy a VW Beetle. They locate a guy selling a project car, but fear it's almost too good to be true at less than 1,000 pounds.
Reliant Kitten: Will and Gus find a Reliant Kitten that an engineer has given up on - the body is detached, it doesn't run and most of the bits it needs are in boxes in the boot.
New York City to Albany: Michael Portillo follows America's iconic River Hudson, beginning at New York City's Penn Station, before sampling ale and meeting the State Senator in Albany.
Schenectady to Niagara Falls: Michael Portillo travels across New York state, discovering how General Electric also leads the way in rail technology.
Simpson to Little Tring: During a cold snap Robbie Cumming gets iced in on the Grand Union Canal. Later, his parents pay a visit and help him through Marsworth Locks.
Napton Junction to Aynho Wharf: Robbie Cumming navigates the scenic Oxford Canal onboard Naughty Lass, explores its twists and turns, and helps tow a stranded broken-down boater.
Aynho Wharf to Bablock Hythe: Robbie navigates the Oxford Canal, bumps into a hire boat and a hedge and tackles large river locks on the scenic Upper River Thames.
In the third part of his journey, Simon Reeve travels through the Andes mountains from Peru to Bolivia, beginning at the world-famous ruins of Machu Pichu.
The adventurer travels to the vast white salt flats of Bolivia, through the world's greatest wetlands of Brazil's Pantanal, and on to the forested heart of Paraguay.
Simon Reeve travels from Chile's Atacama Desert and follows the Andes to Patagonia before ending up in most southerly inhabited region on earth, Tierra Del Fuego.
Ford Escort RS1600i: Irv takes on the restoration of an Escort RS1600i from an owner who had to give it up due to ill health, but it turns out to be a much bigger job than he imagined.

Lotus Carlton Turbo/TR7 Special Edition: Derek's winging his way to Bingley to meet a kindred spirit who's parting with his TR7 after 32 years. Paul and Charlie head to Anglesey to collect a pair of L
Volvo / Insight: The Bangers team can't believe their luck when a 1970s family-favourite, a Volvo 144, rolls through Mathewson with just 15,000 miles on the clock.
VW Beetle / Royal Enfield Cycar: The team think they can smell profit by choosing one of the simplest cars ever built, the VW Beetle.
Mazda MX5 / Moto Guzzi V50: The team opt to buy one of the most affordable sports cars on the road - the Mazda MX-5.
